name: Consensus Voting
description: A simple yes-no vote procedure: if the number of yes votes is greater than or equal to the minimum required, the proposal is passed. If the number of no votes is greater than or equal to the maximum allowed, the proposal is failed. Otherwise, the proposal is still in progress.

check.name: main

default.name: All users in the vote channel

variables.name: minimum_yes_required
variables.label: Minimum number of yes votes required

variables.name: maximum_no_allowed
variables.label: Maximum number of no votes allowed

variables.name: vote_message
variables.label: Vote message
variables.default: Start a yes-no vote: vote with :thumbsup: or :thumbsdown: on this post.

data.name: yes_votes_num
data.label: Number of Yes Votes
data.prompt: How many yes votes are there for this proposal

data.name: no_votes_num
data.label: Number of No Votes
data.prompt: How many no votes are there for this proposal

data.name: thread_post_id
data.label: Thread of the Vote Procedure
data.prompt: What is the thread post id of the vote procedure

name: Benevolent Dictator
description: A benevolent dictator has the final say on all proposals. The dictator can either approve or reject a proposal through a DM with the bot.

check.name: main

variables.name: dictator
variables.label: Benevolent dictator
variables.prompt: Who is the benevolent dictator

variables.name: decision_message
variables.label: Vote message for the dictator
variables.default: Please make a decision on this proposal by yes-or-no voting
variables.prompt: What messages the dictator should be prompted with to make a decision

variables.name: notify_message
variables.label: Notification message for community members
variables.default: We have asked the dictator to make a decision on this proposal
variables.prompt: What messages should we notify other community members when the dictator is asked to make a decision

name: Board Voting
description: Community members of a specified role, i.e. a Board, can vote on a proposal. The board can either approve or reject a proposal through either a designated moderation channel or mpim with the bot.

check.name: main
check.codes:
if not proposal.vote_post_id:
	return None
yes_votes = proposal.get_yes_votes().count()
no_votes = proposal.get_no_votes().count()
proposal.data.set("yes_votes_num", yes_votes)
proposal.data.set("no_votes_num", no_votes)
if yes_votes >= variables.minimum_yes_required:
  return PASSED
elif no_votes >= variables.maximum_no_allowed:
  return FAILED
return PROPOSED

variables.name: decision_message
variables.label: Vote message for board members
variables.default: Please make a decision on this proposal by yes-or-no voting

variables.name: notify_message
variables.label: Notification message for other community members
variables.default: We have asked the board to make a decision on this proposal
variables.prompt: What messages should we notify other community members when board members is asked to make a decision

variables.name: notify_channel
variables.label: Notification channel for other community members
variables.prompt: Which channel should we notify other community members about the decision

variables.name: minimum_yes_required
variables.label: Minimum number of yes votes required
variables.prompt: How many number of yes votes are required to reach success

variables.name: maximum_no_allowed
variables.label: Maximum number of no votes allowed
variables.prompt: How many number of no votes are allowed before we call a failure

data.name: board_members
data.label: Board Members
data.prompt: Given the board role, who are the board members

data.name: yes_votes_num
data.label: Number of Yes Votes
data.prompt: How many yes votes are there for this proposal

data.name: no_votes_num
data.label: Number of No Votes
data.prompt: How many no votes are there for this proposal

name: Quadratic Voting
description: Each voter is given a budget of vote credits that they can spend in order to influence the outcome of a range of decisions. The cost of vote credits is quadratic to the number of votes

check.name: main

notify.title: variables.vote_message
notify.details: Each voter is given a budget of vote credits {variables.vote_budget} that they can spend in order to influence the outcome of a range of decisions. The cost of vote credits is quadratic to the number of votes

variables.name: vote_budget
variables.label: Budget of vote credits
variables.prompt: How many vote credits each eligible voter has

variables.name: candidates
variables.label: Candidates
variables.prompt: Who are the candidates? If there are multiple candidates, separate them by commas

default.name: All users in the vote channel

variables.name: vote_message
variables.label: Vote message
variables.default: Please assign your votes to express the degree of your preferences on each candidate
variables.prompt: Message to be posed in the channel when the vote starts

variables.name: vote_channel
variables.label: Vote channel
variables.prompt: Channel to post the vote message.

variables.name: vote_duration
variables.label: Vote duration (in seconds)
variables.prompt: Duration for the voting process (in seconds)

name: Liquid Democracy
description: The action will be governed through liquid democracy. Voters in a liquid democracy have the right to vote directly on all policy issues (direct democracy); voters also have the option to delegate their votes to someone who will vote on their behalf (representative democracy).

check.name: main

notify.title: Please select the individual you would like to delegate your vote to

default.name: All users in the vote channel

variables.name: delegate_message
variables.label: Delegation message
variables.default: Before deciding on this proposal, people have the opportunity to delegate their votes to another individual who will then be asked to make decisions for this proposal on their behalf. People who have not select their delegates or select themselves as delegates will then need to decide this proposal by themselves
variables.prompt: Message to be posed at the delegation stage

variables.name: procedure_channel
variables.label: Procedure channel
variables.prompt: Channel where the procedure happens.

variables.name: delegate_duration
variables.label: Duration of the delegation process (in seconds)
variables.prompt: Duration for the delegation process (in seconds)

variables.name: vote_duration
variables.label: Duration for the official voting process (in seconds)
variables.prompt: Duration for the official voting process (in seconds)

name: Ranked Voting
description: Each voter is asked to rank candidates, who will then be assigned a socre based on their ranking. The candidate with the highest overall score is the winner.

check.name: main

notify.title: variables.vote_message
notify.details: Each voter is given a budget of vote credits that they can spend in order to influence the outcome of a range of decisions. The cost of vote credits is quadratic to the number of votes

variables.name: max_rank
variables.label: Maximumn rank
variables.prompt: The maximum rank that a voter can assign to a candidate (start from 1)

variables.name: rank_scores
variables.label: Scores for each rank
variables.prompt: It should have the length of Maximumn Rank. Please separate the scores by commas

variables.name: candidates
variables.label: Candidates
variables.prompt: Candidates or issues to be voted on. If there are multiple candidates, separate them by commas

default.name: All users in the vote channel

variables.name: vote_message
variables.label: Vote message
variables.default: Please assign your votes to express the degree of your preferences on each candidate
variables.prompt: Message to be posed in the channel when the vote starts

variables.name: vote_channel
variables.label: Vote channel
variables.prompt: Channel to post the vote message.

variables.name: vote_duration
variables.label: Vote duration (in seconds)
variables.prompt: Duration for the voting process (in seconds)
